results.name: Number of distinct Mersenne primes dividing n.
comment: a(n)=m first occurs at n=A098918(m). - _Robert Israel_, Feb 03 2020
link: Robert Israel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
example: a(21)=2 because 1, 3, 7 and 21 are divisors of 21. Then 21 has two divisors that are Mersenne primes (A000668): 3 and 7.
maple: if m > N then break fi;
for j from m by m to N do
